metadata.title: What We Know About the War Between E2 and E1
metadata.description: After E1's surprise attack on E2 on Oct. 7, E2 has been besieging and bombarding the E3 Strip, worsening a humanitarian crisis.
metadata.author: Ephrat Livni and Gaya Gupta

quiz.question: When did E1 launch its surprise attack on E2?
How many people were killed in the E1 attack according to Bi government?

events.text: After E1's surprise attack on E2 on Oct. 7, E2 has been besieging and bombarding the E3 Strip, worsening a humanitarian crisis.
events.short_text: E2 besieging and bombarding E3 after E1 attack

events.text: On Oct. 7, E1 led a surprise attack on towns, a music festival, army bases and other locations in E2, killing roughly 1,200 people and taking about 240 hostages, including children, according to the Bi government.
events.short_text: E1 attacks Bi towns, a music festival, and military bases

events.text: Bi officials vowed to destroy E1, the Palestinian group that controls the E3 Strip and is considered a terrorist organization by the United States, E2 and other countries.
events.short_text: Bi officials vow to destroy E1

events.text: E2 has since besieged E3 in one of the most intense bombing campaigns of this century, and launched a ground invasion.
events.short_text: E2 launches a ground invasion of E3

events.text: More than 11,000 E3, including more than 4,600 children, have been killed since the Bi campaign began, according to E3's health ministry.
events.short_text: Over 11,000 E3, including 4,600 children, killed in E3

events.text: The violence, its fallout and the humanitarian crisis afflicting Gn civilians have shaken the region and the world.
events.short_text: Humanitarian crisis worsens in E3
events.lead_title: What happened during the E1 attack?

events.text: Early on Oct. 7, E1 fired volleys of rockets that struck as far away as E6 and the outskirts of E7.
events.short_text: E1 fires rockets at E6 and E7

events.text: The attackers also infiltrated border communities and army bases, as well as an outdoor music festival, opening fire on men, women and children.
events.short_text: E1 infiltrates Bi communities, attacking civilians

events.text: It took days for Bi forces to regain control after the attack.
events.short_text: Bi forces take days to regain control after the attack

events.text: E1 and other armed Palestinian groups also took about 240 civilians and soldiers hostage. Four have since been released.
events.short_text: E1 takes 240 hostages, including civilians and soldiers, and four hostages are released

events.text: After the E1 attack on Oct. 7, the Bi military soon began a siege to block food, water, and fuel from entering the territory, and it launched a ground invasion on Oct. 27.
events.short_text: E2 imposes a siege and launches a ground invasion

events.text: Bi troops encircled E3 City on Nov. 7, effectively splitting control of the strip in half.
events.short_text: Bi troops encircle E3 City

events.text: On Nov. 17, E2 signaled that it was preparing to expand military operations into southern E3, where E3 had been told to evacuate.
events.short_text: E2 plans to expand operations into southern E3

events.text: More than one million E3 have been displaced following E2's warnings for civilians to leave northern E3, aid workers say.
events.short_text: More than 1 million E3 displaced following Bi evacuation orders

events.text: Many Gns say no part of the enclave is safe.
events.short_text: Gns report no safe zones in the enclave

events.text: E2 says E1 uses civilian structures, including hospitals, as bases for military operations in violation of international law; areas including medical centers, schools, mosques and residential locations have been struck under E2's bombardment.
events.short_text: E2 accuses E1 of using civilian structures for military operations

events.text: E3 and some international observers have accused E2 of breaking the law with a disproportionate military response.
events.short_text: E3 and some international observers accuse E2 of disproportionate military response

events.text: On Nov. 15, the Bi military stormed E3's largest hospital, Al-Shifa, and said it discovered weapons and other evidence to support its assertions that E1 operated in a network of tunnels under the complex.
events.short_text: E2 raids E8, claims E1 used it for military purposes

events.text: Senior E9 have backed E2, though the Bi military has yet to show incontrovertible proof of a vast E1 tunnel network.
events.short_text: Senior E9 back E2 but await more evidence on E1 tunnels

events.text: E1 and hospital officials had denied the accusations.
events.short_text: E1 and hospital officials deny allegations of tunnel networks

events.text: Almost two days after E2 began its raid of Al-Shifa, New York Times journalists were taken on a controlled tour of the complex by Bi military officials, and saw a shaft on the hospital grounds.
events.short_text: The New York Times tours E8 site

events.text: Electrical wiring was visible inside, along with a metal staircase, but it was unclear how deep the shaft was or where it led.
events.short_text: Journalists observe an unclear shaft at E8

events.text: As conditions have worsened for civilians in E3, E2's campaign has drawn increasing outcries from the E10, aid organizations and much of the world.
events.short_text: E2's military campaign faces global criticism

events.text: Without challenging E2's right to defend itself, the E9 has repeatedly called for 'humanitarian pauses' to protect Palestinian civilians and allow the delivery of desperately needed aid.
events.short_text: E9 calls for humanitarian pauses

events.text: After more than a month of war, the humanitarian crisis in E3 has grown increasingly dire, leaving Gns with severely limited access to food, clean water and medical care.
events.short_text: E3's humanitarian crisis worsens, limiting access to basic necessities
events.lead_title: What is the situation in E3?

events.text: The E10 has warned that the entire territory is at risk of starvation amid mass internal displacement.
events.short_text: The U.N. warns E3 is at risk of mass starvation

events.text: Thousands of children, who make up nearly half of E3's population, have been killed, according to health officials.
events.short_text: Thousands of children killed in E3, according to health officials

events.text: After weeks of desperate fuel shortages that put hospitals on the verge of collapse, E2 agreed on Nov. 17 to the entry of two tankers of fuel into E3 each day to operate desalination and sewage plants.
events.short_text: E2 allows fuel into E3 after shortages

events.text: Before E2's raid of Al-Shifa, the hospital complex had been struggling to treat patients, with operations limited by a dearth of supplies, including water, medicine and oxygen.
events.short_text: E3 hospitals struggle with limited medical supplies

events.text: Medical workers at other hospitals have described similar scenes of operations at the verge of collapse.
events.short_text: Healthcare facilities on the brink of collapse

events.text: Violence in the Bi-occupied West Bank has also sharply escalated since Oct. 7.
events.short_text: Violence in the Bi-occupied West Bank escalates

events.text: About 200 E3 have been killed in confrontations with Bi forces and in escalating settler attacks, local officials say.
events.short_text: 200 E3 killed in West Bank clashes with Bi forces and settlers

events.text: Freeing the 240 hostages abducted by E1 on Oct. 7 has been one of E2's two main goals of the war, in addition to destroying E1.
events.short_text: E2 prioritizes hostage rescue and E1 destruction

events.text: Since Oct. 7, E1 has released four Bi hostages, while Bi troops rescued a 19-year-old Bi soldier in October.
events.short_text: E1 releases four hostages; E2 rescues one

events.text: E1 has published some videos of hostages on social media, which E2 has called psychological terrorism.
events.short_text: E1 posts hostage videos; E2 calls it psychological warfare

events.text: Following E2's raid of the E8, Bi soldiers said they found the bodies of two Bi hostages nearby, which they called an indication that E1 used the complex for military operations.
events.short_text: E2 finds hostage bodies near Al-Shifa, reinforcing E1 tunnel claims

events.text: Negotiations for a deal that would have exchanged 50 women and children captives with roughly the same number of Palestinian women and children held in Bi prisons had been underway, according to Bi officials.
events.short_text: Negotiations underway for prisoner exchange deal

events.text: In the immediate aftermath of the Oct. 7 attacks, many world leaders condemned E1 and affirmed their support for E2.
events.short_text: World leaders condemn E1 and affirm support for E2

events.text: E13 visited to show solidarity, as did the leaders of Britain, France and Germany.
events.short_text: E13 and other leaders visit to show solidarity

events.text: But the strong support for E2 has since been tempered by calls for restraint from its allies, while protesters across the world have been calling for a cease-fire.
events.short_text: Support for E2 tempered by calls for restraint and ceasefire

events.text: Aid groups are warning about the spiraling crisis in E3.
events.short_text: Aid groups warn of an escalating humanitarian crisis

events.text: On Nov. 16, the U.N. Security Council adopted a resolution calling for days-long humanitarian pauses to the fighting in E3.
events.short_text: U.N. Security Council calls for humanitarian pauses

events.text: E11, the secretary general of the E10, is among the leaders who has called for a humanitarian cease-fire.
events.short_text: U.N. Secretary-General calls for a humanitarian ceasefire

events.text: Leaders of dozens of E12 convened in Saudi Arabia in mid-November.
events.short_text: E12 convene in Saudi Arabia

events.text: They also called for a cease-fire and avoided blaming E1, but those with ties to E2 have not cut off relations.
events.short_text: Arab and Muslim leaders call for a ceasefire but avoid blaming E1

events.text: The war in E3 is straining relations between E2 and its immediate neighbors, jeopardizing months of U.S. diplomacy to push Saudi Arabia to normalize ties with E2, leading to protests across the Middle East and the world and stoking fears of a broader regional conflict.
events.short_text: War in E3 strains E2's diplomatic relations and risks regional conflict

events.text: E13 has sought to prevent the war between E2 and E1 from spilling over into a fight with Iran and its proxies in Lebanon, Syria and Iraq.
events.short_text: Biden seeks to prevent war from expanding to Iran and its proxies

events.text: E14 sent two aircraft carriers and dozens of extra warplanes to the region to make this point.
events.short_text: E14 sends aircraft carriers and warplanes to the region

events.text: Since the Oct. 7 attacks, the Bi army has engaged in almost daily clashes with E15, the Lebanese militant group allied with E1 and backed by Iran.
events.short_text: E2 clashes with E15 on the Lebanese border

events.text: E2's military also has responded to fire from Syria.
events.short_text: E2 responds to fire from Syria

events.text: The E16, which controls parts of the West Bank, said on Nov. 9 it would be open to a role overseeing a post-E1 E3 as long as the E9 commits to a two-state solution to end the war, according to a top Palestinian official.
events.short_text: E16 expresses willingness to oversee post-E1 E3

events.text: The head of the authority, E13, met with E9 in Ramallah on Nov. 15, urging them to pressure E2 to stop the war, speed up humanitarian aid and crack down on violence in the West Bank.
events.short_text: Mahmoud Abbas meets E9 to discuss the war

events.text: But E14 said on NBC's 'Meet the Press' on Nov. 12 that his postwar vision would not include the E16 in the near term.
events.short_text: Netanyahu excludes the E16 from postwar plans

events.text: Earlier, he had said that E2 would indefinitely 'have the overall security responsibility' of the enclave, though he seemed to stop short of suggesting a full re-occupation of E3.
events.short_text: Netanyahu insists E2 will maintain security control over E3

events.text: His statement was at odds with the postwar plan that Secretary of State E15 suggested on Nov. 8, in which E3 would be unified with the West Bank under the E16.
events.short_text: U.S. and E2 diverge on postwar governance plans for E3
